summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Lock and Security Supervisor (Acting Facilities Manager) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein while in BOP custody at MCC New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; a previously housed inmate at MCC New York who died while in custody.

events.title: OIG Interview of MCC Lock and Security Supervisor
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary, recorded interview with the Acting Facilities Manager/Lock and Security Supervisor of MCC New York regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email regarding Facilities Manager
events.description: An email (attachment to the report) dated August 9, 2019, concerning the Facilities Manager position at MCC New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (DOJ OIG Reporting Office)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is actively investigating the death of Jeffrey Epstein in BOP custody as of August 2021.
The interview subject was the Acting Facilities Manager (Lock and Security Supervisor) at MCC New York during a portion of Epstein's incarceration there.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the report includes attachments such as the transcript, a signed warnings form, a 2019 email, and a screenshot of MCC Special Housing Unit video.
Jeffrey Epstein's BOP register number was 76318-054.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum containing no recommendations or conclusions, and its distribution is restricted to the receiving agency.
